metadata.name: Udnē #515
metadata.description:
Udnē is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at Performance in Code: Deciphering Value in Generative Art, Art Basel Miami Beach, 2022.

Udnē is a collection of asymmetric textural compositions. It's a search for creating harmonies and disharmonies by combining 3 colors with 3 unsynchronized mathematical equations. Udnē explores the beauty within triadic compositions while attempting to integrate two contrasting textures by forming instances of non-figurative scenes. The collection is a reflection of integrated and contrasting textures in micro and macro scale that we see in our everyday life environment.

You can press 's' in liveMode to save as 1000x1000px .png.

In liveMode, add '&density=7’ to the end of the URL to render at high resolution (7000x7000px). You can use 5, 7 or 10 for different resolutions. It will automatically download when the rendering is finished. 

Some compositions might take longer to render in low-performance computers. Please be patient and enjoy the process!

As a rare probability there is an intentionally kept glitch.

Made with p5js.
@distcollective, November 2022

metadata.name: Archiplex II #30
metadata.description: Archiplex II lays its foundations on Brutalist and Bauhaus design. Through simple, triangular shapes and hand-picked, bold colour palettes, this long-form series explores how generative methods can play and meld with these traditional architectural and design forms.

metadata.name: EDDY #23
metadata.description:
An eddy is a circular movement of water counter to a main current. It reminds me of innovations in art, like a small countercurrent to the mainstream, surfacing new techniques and aesthetics. 

I hope that EDDY will brighten your days with its playful swirl of colors, inspired by the sea, the sky, the birds, and post-impressionist paintings.

Keyboard Controls:
[F] Fill the window.
[S] Save the current view in live mode as an image (default 1125x1500px).
[1] [2] [4] [6] Change resolution, 1.5K to 9K.
[R] Reverse course.

Made with p5js and shaders.

Created by elsif, 2022.12.

metadata.description:

metadata.name: Unfolded #164
metadata.description:
A plane is repeatedly folded over itself, choosing creases either at random, or according to some pattern (like a grid). These creases form the boundaries of the individual textured tiles.

Once the folds are complete, they are undone in reverse order, recreating the original plane. With each unfolding, the orientation of each crease (as a mountain or a valley), and each tile (facing up or down) is recorded as a sequence of 1s and 0s. Tiles are colored and textured according to similarities in these binary sequences, giving rise to subtle symmetries and repetitions.

Written in vanilla JS & HTML5 Canvas.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Gossamer #44
metadata.description: An exploration of texture, inspired by fabric suspended in the air.

metadata.name: YANF #82
metadata.description:
Yet Another Noises and Flows

After three works on landscapes I returned to an abstract work in which I used several kinds of noise fields and a different approach to flow lines.

In this work I use three intermediate images to generate the final image:
- on the first image to each pixels is assigned a color related to the value of the noise field in that point using the main color palette
- on the second image the gradient orientation (angle) of the field is used to assign colors using a secondary palette with the purpose of giving lights and shadows to the final image
- on the third image flow lines are drawn using the direction perpendicular to the gradient, in this way the flows are aligned to the contour lines

After the second and third step the new generated image is blended with the previous giving rise to the final image.

Developed with p5.js

Default resolution: 2400x1600, 1600x2400, 2000x2000 (3/2, 2/3, 1/1 aspect ratio)

[2] to redraw at double resolution (it takes four times then default)
[1] to redraw at default resolution
[s] to save a png at current resolution

Sources of variations are:
- 14 palettes
- 6 kinds of combinations of noise type and fractal type
- 8 kinds of cuts
- 3 kinds of aspect ratio
- 3 border thickness

This Generative Token uses the FastNoiseLite.js and chroma.js libraries.

Created by Andrea Belloni, fxhash: anbello, twitter: @Waterflowing0. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: ZigZag #352
metadata.description:
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃ ZigZag ⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Wikipedia
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

A zigzag is a pattern made up of small corners at variable angles, though constant within the zigzag, tracing a path between two parallel lines; it can be described as both jagged and fairly regular.
In geometry, this pattern is described as a skew apeirogon. From the point of view of symmetry, a regular zigzag can be generated from a simple motif like a line segment by repeated application of a glide reflection.

Another name for the pattern is "Herringbone" FYI 🤓

There's a chance no lines are shown at all, this is intentional, as I love "bugs" 🪲

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Keys
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

[b] toggle border
[n] toggle noise
[h] generate high res version
[s] save image

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Education - back to 1994
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

Zig and Zag are also 2 puppets, have a look here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zig_and_Zag_(puppets)
There's this amazing song if you don't know called "Zig & Zag - Them Girls Them Girls".
You can view it on Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7bv_36P_f-w

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Special thanks
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

Liam Egan, for helping me with noise through a shader

⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃
Royalties on secondary
⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃⌄⌃

40% Liam Egan
40% Obi
20% WTBS

metadata.name: Plasma Flux #138
metadata.description:
Generative artwork made using p5.js and WebGL

Press 's' to save a high-res copy of your output.
Press 'a' to animate continuously once fully drawn.

2022 Felix Jennings, CC BY-NC 4.0

metadata.name: Geode #180
metadata.description:
A single seed shape is chosen from 13, and placed onto the plane. At every step, a copy of this seed is laid edge-to-edge adjacent to an existing shape, without causing any overlaps. This copy is colored based on the edge it shares with the existing shape. The process continues until the animation completes.

New shapes are placed closest to a moving target. In some mints, this target is slow moving, causing new shapes to expand radially from the seed. In other mints, this target races around, causing new shapes to chase it. 

Each of the 13 shapes forms different patterns under different circumstances. Not all patterns will be explored.

Controls:
  - SPACE: Pause/unpause the animation.
  - ENTER: Skip the animation.
  - R: Restart the animation.

URL Params:
  - "preview=1": Skip the animation.
  - "flex=1": Adapt the boundaries to the size of the window.
  - “slow=1”: Draw only one shape per frame.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Con(text)ual #86
metadata.description:
Con(text)ual is a generative painting made from ASCII characters confined into shapes. Shapes are randomly drawn onto the canvas, then filled with individual characters from a character array. The density of characters is dependent upon the size of the shape, creating some transparencies and an organic feel to each shape.

I've long been interested in typography as an artform and this is an extension of my typography explorations.

There are a total of 10 color pallets. The number of shapes on each canvas varies from 3 to 9. The edition size was chosen based on the code, which lends itself well to a wide array of potential outcomes. Please get in touch with me if you want a larger resolution size for printing. 

I hope you enjoy the art!

Made with 100% Code and p5.js
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Suspiro #63
metadata.description:
Deep in the heart, beside the lung, there is something inexplicable, an emotion, perhaps a passion, that only forms and abstractions are capable of understanding. Who knows, one day I may be able to transmit this feat through art made of code, mathematics of feelings seeks to understand and extract something so sublime from within me.

made with p5.js
eduxdux | december 2022

metadata.name: Pearls #90
metadata.description:
Pearls is a generative minimal artwork made with 100% code in p5js.

This algorithm places perfectly round pearls into multiple stacked grids and connects them in a pleasing way. The small grids lead to interesting emerging patterns. Some see faces and fish, others see ancient hardware and elephants, and some just enjoy the minimal simplicity.

-- controls (in live view)
s: to save the current image
a: to play a small animation

-- some attributes
layout: 2x2 to 34x34
palette: genuary, monochrome red & purple, night
mode: ink, walk
bias: central, north, east, south, west
density: sparse, middle, dense
symmetry: none, vertical, horizontal, point
layer: 2 to 6

metadata.name: Sputnik #69
metadata.description:
Each output is generated by layering Blender renders.

Each 'Sputnik' output forms a bold, striking 'space-age' design, reminicent of sci-fi insignia.

In live mode:
Click/tap the image to make a "Download image" button appear. Click this button to download a 1500x2000px PNG.
